page.title: 13Mrs. Acland_Hood
page.content: The{Acland_Hood ancestry}stretches back to the times of Henry I. They have been living at{Wootton House,} in Butleigh Wootton, since 1649. The house was built by the Hoods' ancestors and they moved into it as soon as it was finished. It has been expanded and parts of it knocked down since then. The main house is still Jacobite, but the wings are Regency. {The gardens}are now open to the public. The Acland_Hoods are the main landowners in this area, owning 1000 acres. They own land around Street, Glastonbury and on Sedgemoor. Most of the land is rented out, being used mostly for mixed farming.{Butleigh {Monument}was built by the officers of Admiral Samuel Hood in 1830, on his command. The name originates from Admiral Alexander Hood marrying Miss Acland.
